name.title: Name
name.description: A string giving a single classification value for a Python package.

_artifact.title: artifact
_artifact.description: Artifact file representing the physical content

_relative_path.title: relative path
_relative_path.description: Path where the artifact is located relative to distributions base_path

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The name of the distribution package, usually of the format: {distribution}-{version}(-{build tag})?-{python tag}-{abi tag}-{platform tag}.{packagetype}

packagetype.title: Packagetype
packagetype.description: The type of the distribution package (e.g. sdist, bdist_wheel, bdist_egg, etc)

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the python project.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: A one-line summary of what the package does.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the package that can run to several paragraphs.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: Additional keywords to be used to assist searching for the package in a larger catalog.

home_page.title: Home page
home_page.description: The URL for the package's home page.

download_url.title: Download url
download_url.description: Legacy field denoting the URL from which this package can be downloaded.

author.title: Author
author.description: Text containing the author's name. Contact information can also be added, separated with newlines.

maintainer.title: Maintainer
maintainer.description: The maintainer's name at a minimum; additional contact information may be provided.

license.title: License
license.description: Text indicating the license covering the distribution

requires_python.title: Requires python
requires_python.description: The Python version(s) that the distribution is guaranteed to be compatible with.

project_url.title: Project url
project_url.description: A browsable URL for the project and a label for it, separated by a comma.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: A comma-separated list of platform specifications, summarizing the operating systems supported by the package.

supported_platform.title: Supported platform
supported_platform.description: Field to specify the OS and CPU for which the binary package was compiled.

requires_dist.title: Requires dist
requires_dist.description: A JSON list containing names of some other distutils project required by this distribution.

provides_dist.title: Provides dist
provides_dist.description: A JSON list containing names of a Distutils project which is contained within this distribution.

obsoletes_dist.title: Obsoletes dist
obsoletes_dist.description: A JSON list containing names of a distutils project's distribution which this distribution renders obsolete, meaning that the two projects should not be installed at the same time.

requires_external.title: Requires external
requires_external.description: A JSON list containing some dependency in the system that the distribution is to be used.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this publisher.

_last_updated.title: last updated
_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the most recent update of the publisher configuration.

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: A URI of the repository to be synchronized.

repository_version.title: Repository Version
repository_version.description: A URI of the repository version to be published.

type.title: Type
type.description: A type of digest: i.e. sha256, md5

version_specifier.title: Version specifier
version_specifier.description: A version specifier, accepts standard python versions syntax: >=, <=, ==, ~=, >, <, ! can be used in conjunction with other specifiers i.e. >1,<=3,!=3.0.2. Note that the specifiers treat pre-released versions as < released versions, so 3.0.0a1 < 3.0.0. Not setting the version_specifier will sync all the pre-released and released versions.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this remote.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL of an external content source.

validate.title: Validate
validate.description: If True, the plugin will validate imported artifacts.

ssl_ca_certificate.title: Ssl ca certificate
ssl_ca_certificate.description: A PEM encoded CA certificate used to validate the server certificate presented by the remote server.

ssl_client_certificate.title: Ssl client certificate
ssl_client_certificate.description: A PEM encoded client certificate used for authentication.

ssl_client_key.title: Ssl client key
ssl_client_key.description: A PEM encoded private key used for authentication.

ssl_validation.title: Ssl validation
ssl_validation.description: If True, SSL peer validation must be performed.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to be used for authentication when syncing.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to be used for authentication when syncing.

_last_updated.title: last updated
_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the most recent update of the remote.

policy.title: Policy
policy.description: The policy to use when downloading content. The possible values include: 'immediate', 'on_demand', and 'cache_only'. 'immediate' is the default.

prereleases.title: Prereleases
prereleases.description: Whether or not to include pre-release packages in the sync.

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: A URI of the repository to be synchronized.

mirror.title: Mirror
mirror.description: The synchronization mode, True for "mirror" and False for "additive" mode.
